content.title: Introduction to Sustainable Energy System Transformation
content.cta: Scroll, tab or use your keyboard to move ahead

content.text: Module 1 presents a comprehensive overview of the complex landscape of energy within the global development agenda and provides an essential foundation by defining and exploring the interconnected concepts of sustainable energy with global challenges such as climate change, fossil fuel dependency, energy poverty and disparities and opportunities such as local development, economic growth and energy security. It assesses progress towards achieving Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) 7, which aims to ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable, and modern energy for everyone by 2030, while also exploring the critical interlinkages between with other SDGs. The module seeks to equip readers with approaches, methods and tools for SDG7 acceleration and innovation. Further, this module will outline the objectives and content of the Sustainable Energy Academy and present the approach of the United Nations Development Program (UNDP) to achieving the global sustainable energy transition through its Energy Moonshot flagship

content.title: Learning Objectives
content.intro: If you only have space to remember 3 things:

objectives.title: Understand the concept of sustainable energy and its link with sustainable development.
Appreciate the energy challenges and opportunities faced around the world.
Identify opportunities for synergies presented by the intersection of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and the Sustainable Energy-for-Development pathways.
Review strategies for building effective partnerships and leverage approaches, methods and tools for accelerating the energy transition.
Meaningfully contribute to UNDP's activities or otherwise to accelerate the global sustainable energy transition.
